Interface Originator<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the object whose state is managed by the originator.
All Known Implementing Classes:
OriginatorImpl
public interface Originator<T>
Represents the Originator in the Memento design pattern. The originator is responsible for creating mementos to capture its state and restoring its state from a memento.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    restoreState(Memento<T> memento)
    Restores the originator's state from the given memento.
    Memento<T>
    saveState()
    Creates a memento capturing the current state of the originator.

  • Method Details

    • saveState

      Memento<T> saveState()
      Creates a memento capturing the current state of the originator.
      Returns:
      a Memento containing the current state of the originator.

    • restoreState

      void restoreState(Memento<T> memento)
      Restores the originator's state from the given memento.
      Parameters:
      memento - the memento containing the state to restore. Must not be null.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the provided memento is null.
